solution_line_template: If one "AVN" is half the price of one "The Dark" CD, that means one CD of "The Dark" costs {avn_cd_price} * {dark_cd_price_multiplier} = $<<{avn_cd_price}*{dark_cd_price_multiplier}={dark_cd_price}>>{dark_cd_price}.
So for {num_dark_cds} "The Dark" CDs, Alan needs to pay {dark_cd_price} * {num_dark_cds} = $<<{dark_cd_price}*{num_dark_cds}={total_dark_cds_cost}>>{total_dark_cds_cost}.
So all CDs cost by now {avn_cd_price} + {total_dark_cds_cost} = $<<{avn_cd_price}+{total_dark_cds_cost}={cost_of_other_cds}>>{cost_of_other_cds}.
That means for all CDs Alan needs to pay {cost_of_other_cds} + {nineties_music_cds_cost} = $<<{cost_of_other_cds}+{nineties_music_cds_cost}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
